Posted By: EvilCleavage (8/4/2010 10:17:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Actually in casual decks still very playable, despite the power creep. I had it in a multiplayer deck together with [masked admirers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=masked admirers). Whenever someone would play mass removal, the treefolk would go to my hand. Then I could replay it, which would trigger the advisers, so I could replay them too. Sure did cost a lot of mana, but I kept having two creatures no matter what happened, and was drawing cards to boot.

posts.post_content: I used this guy in an extended green/red beatdown deck back when Judgement was released. Discarding an [anger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=anger) to [wild mongrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wild mongrel) gives him haste and practically breaks him.

posts.post_content:
Definitely a decent recurring body that ensures some card advantage, given that it doesn't get exiled from removal spells like [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), for instance.  
  
Notably this is also the only Treefolk with power greater than toughness.

Posted By: GengilOrbios (7/11/2011 12:43:55 AM)

posts.post_content:
Card of the Week #2  
Previous card - Deepcavern Imp  
  
I love green. I want to say that, because I just do. It's easily my favourite color. So much fun, in a very straight forward way. And really that's what I love about green: it's straight forward. It does simple things, like beat for five, in very nice fun ways. Frankly I think this card is just good and fun. Beats spot removal, beats board wipes and beats face.   
  
But that's not even the best part of green, the best part of green is that there is always some sort of fun and cool interactions it has, but it is often ignored because of how straightforward the cards look.  
  
While that second point may not be valid with this specific card, as kookster will tell you with that really cool combo he has jury rigged together to kill in a really unpredictable way, I say it still stands with a lot of really cool green cards, and a lot of green in general.  
  
But, where can you make this card work in EDH?  
  
It serves a function in an Asmira deck. 2GGG... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

But that's not even the best part of green, the best part of green is that there is always some sort of fun and cool interactions it has, but it is often ignored because of how straightforward the cards look.

While that second point may not be valid with this specific card, as kookster will tell you with that really cool combo he has jury rigged together to kill in a really unpredictable way, I say it still stands with a lot of really cool green cards, and a lot of green in general.

But, where can you make this card work in EDH?

It serves a function in an Asmira deck. 2GGG... (see all)

posts.post_content: I had two of these back in the day. After quite a few humiliating losses due to this, most of my friends refused to play against me as long as I used them, and I didn't even ramp. None of them played counterspells, obviously, and removal with exile was rarer in those days. Still a great card.
